pullrequest.title: Implement virtual evidence for all segway tasks

content.raw:
prior\_list is actually a one-dimensional numpy array. So, this expression will return a boolean array. The reason the != None exists is to account for someone who only specifies a single label as 0 probability. This could result in an array looking something like:

`[0, None, None]`

If this were passed to any\(prior\_list\) it would return False, but needs to be true so we can apply the proper prior to the other two labels.
content.html:
prior_list is actually a one-dimensional numpy array. So, this expression will return a boolean array. The reason the != None exists is to account for someone who only specifies a single label as 0 probability. This could result in an array looking something like:

[0, None, None]

If this were passed to any(prior_list) it would return False, but needs to be true so we can apply the proper prior to the other two labels.
